alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 4:48PM EDT until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Kershaw and Richland. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Camden, Lake Wateree Dam, Elgin, Lugoff, Pine Grove Fire Station, North Towne Square Shopping Center and Fort Jackson McCrady Training Center. - This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 84 and 98. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
